title: THE DESCENT TOGETHER
content:
Mrs. Park moves faster than an eighty-three-year-old woman should be able to move.

You're taking the stairs two at a time, and she's keeping pace—not complaining, not slowing, just following with the grim efficiency of someone who survived the war, buried a husband, and didn't get this far by being fragile.

The bite on her arm is bandaged now. You wrapped it yourself, in her kitchen, with supplies from her first-aid kit. She didn't say anything while you worked. Didn't need to. You both know what a bite means.

But she's not turning yet. However long she has—hours, maybe, or minutes—she's using it to help you escape.

"The Hyundai is in B2,"

she says, not even winded.

"Taehyun's old parking spot. Number 47. Keys are in the lockbox in the glove compartment. Code is our anniversary—0312."

March 12th. You file it away. The date her husband proposed, or the date they married, or some other moment that mattered enough to become a password.

"When you get out—"

She stops on the landing. Ninth floor. You stop with her, watching her face in the flickering emergency light.

"My daughter. Soojin. She lives in Busan. Here—"

She presses something into your hand. A photograph, wallet-sized, worn at the edges. A woman in her fifties, smiling, with Mrs. Park's eyes.

"Tell her I wasn't afraid. Tell her I helped someone. Tell her—"

Her voice breaks. For the first time since this started, she looks her age. Looks fragile. Looks like someone who knows she's saying goodbye.

"Tell her I set a place for her father. Every night. Because love doesn't end when the person does."

You don't trust yourself to speak. You nod. Tuck the photograph into your pocket, next to your phone, next to everything else you're carrying from the world that was.

She takes a breath. Steadies herself. And then she's moving again—down the stairs, around the landing, into the darkness below.

Seventh floor. Fifth. Third. The sounds from outside are getting louder—or maybe you're just getting closer to them. Car alarms. Screaming. Something heavy hitting something else, over and over.

The garage door is ahead. B2. Mrs. Park's hand finds your arm, grips tight.

"There will be things in there. There are always things in parking garages—I watch movies, I know."

She almost smiles.

"You have the gun?"

You have her husband's gun. Three bullets. You checked.

"I'll distract them. You get to the car. Number 47."

"No. We go together—"

"Yuna."

Her voice is gentle. Final.

"I'm going to turn. Maybe in an hour. Maybe in ten minutes. I don't know. But when it happens, I don't want to be anywhere near you."

She squeezes your arm. Hard.

"Let me do this. Let me choose how it ends. For me. For Taehyun. For all the years I spent setting that extra place at the table."

The garage door looms ahead. Whatever is on the other side, you'll have to face it. Together, or alone.

What do you do?

choices.text: "Okay. But promise me—if you feel it happening, you'll tell me."
"No. We stay together. We get to the car together. I won't let you die alone."
"There's another way. The rooftop. Helicopters. Maybe they can help you."
